intro: Cyrtandra crebra, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a leathery texture. Cyrtandra crebra plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing habitat and food for various native insects and birds.
